elements.title: Sodankylä Old Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sodankylä Old Church (pictured) is one of the oldest preserved wooden churches in Finland?

elements.title: Henri Berény (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that due to his Hungarian background, composer Henri Berény was banned from living and working in Paris during World War I and his home was seized by the French government?

elements.title: Hypericum × inodorum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite its name meaning 'unscented', Hypericum × inodorum can smell strongly of goat?

elements.title: Ruth Gottesman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ruth Gottesman donated $1 billion to ensure free tuition for all students at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine?

elements.title: Until August (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gabriel García Márquez asked his sons to destroy Until August, but they instead published it after his death?

elements.title: Zig Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zig Jackson is the first contemporary Native American photographer to be represented in the collections of the Library of Congress?

elements.title: Artists4Ceasefire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that hundreds of actors and other artists, as members of Artists4Ceasefire, are calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza?

elements.title: Ernie Shore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ernie Shore pitched a combined no-hitter with Babe Ruth?

elements.title: Shank Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actor Corey Feldman knocked his own tooth out at Shank Hall?
